com.ibm.watson.dsm.platform

Interface ISharedDataPlatform<DESC extends ISharedDataDescriptor,DATA extends ISharedData<DESC>,STORAGE extends IDataStorage<DESC,DATA>,QUERY extends IDataQuery<DESC,DATA>,QUERYRESULT extends IQueryResult<DESC,DATA>,CONDITION extends IDataCondition<DESC,DATA,QUERY,QUERYRESULT>,ACTION extends IDataAction<DESC,DATA,STORAGE,QUERYRESULT>>

  • All Known Subinterfaces:
    ISharedBeanPlatform, ISharedTuplePlatform
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    AbstractMonitoringServer, AbstractSharedDataPlatform, DebugEventServer, DistributedApplicationObserver, SharedBeanPlatform, SharedTuplePlatform

    public interface ISharedDataPlatform<DESC extends ISharedDataDescriptor,DATA extends ISharedData<DESC>,STORAGE extends IDataStorage<DESC,DATA>,QUERY extends IDataQuery<DESC,DATA>,QUERYRESULT extends IQueryResult<DESC,DATA>,CONDITION extends IDataCondition<DESC,DATA,QUERY,QUERYRESULT>,ACTION extends IDataAction<DESC,DATA,STORAGE,QUERYRESULT>>
    Provides support for implementing a single distributed application instance. Facilities provided include:
    1. Providing local data store.
    2. Direct query of peer data stores.
    3. Notification to peers of changes to data in the local data store.
    4. Local notification of changes to data in one or more of the peers' data stores.
    5. Notification of changes in the topology of the application's peers.
    6. Sending and local delivery of directly addressed messages.
    The instance is associated with a name space. All applications using the same name space collaborate to share data among themselves. Each instance has a unique identifier. The global name space and the identifier are captured in an IApplicationDescriptor and is used to identify instances of ISharedDataPlatform.

    Then primary facility enabled here is the controlled sharing and querying of data from peers. Queries may be synchronous or continuous. The following may be specified when making either of these queries:

    1. Target peers. Peers may be specified using:
      • a TopologyRelationship such as neighbor, reachable, parent, etc.
      • IPeerSelector a general selector from among those in the name space
    2. Data specification - an IDataQuery object is used to query both local and remote data.
    3. Condition - an IDataCondition instance may be used to compare data among local and the 1 or more peers.

    The queryRemoteData() family of methods is used to issue synchronous queries, and the addRemoteDataListener() family of methods is used to create continuous queries. Continuous queries required an IDataAction implementation to receive the notification of the query results.

    Before the platform can be used, the start() method must be called. In addition, the stop() must/should be called when the platform is not longer needed.

    Example

     ISharedDataPlatform platform = ...;
 IDataAction action = new MyDataAction();
 platform.start();
 ...
 ISharedData sd = ...;          // Data is shared using wrappers that give names and other descriptive information.
 platform.shareData(data);      // Places the data in the shared storage, where it is visible to peers.
 ...
 IDataQuery q = ...;                    // Query a specific piece of data.  Queries can be done my data name, for example.
 platform.addRemoteDataListener(TopologyRelationship.Neighbor, q, action);      // Listens data matching the query in neighboring peers.
 ...
 platform.stop();

    The above example, leaves out details, such as the implementations of ISharedDataPlatform, ISharedData and IDataQuery. This is because this interface is a generic interface, with sub-interfaces defined based on the type of data that is being shared. Currently, there are two sub-interfaces defined:

    • ISharedBeanPlatform - defines the data to be shared as a serializable Java object.
    • ISharedTuplePlatform - defines the data to be shared as ITupleSet which is a intended to represent rows of a relational database table.
    Each of these has an associated set of interfaces and implementations for ISharedData, IDataStorage, IDataQuery, IQueryResult IDataCondition and IDataAction.
    Author:
    dawood

      • queryRemoteData

        java.util.List<? extends QUERYRESULT> queryRemoteData(IPeerSelector apps,
                                                    QUERY query)
        Query data from each peer specified. Queries use a timeout defined by setQueryTimeout(long).
        Parameters:
        apps -
        query - may be null, in which case all data is returned for each peer.
        Returns:
        never null. A list of query results from peers who responded within the timeout.

      • isSatisfied

        java.util.List<IApplicationDescriptor> isSatisfied(IPeerSelector apps,
                                                 CONDITION condition)
                                                   throws DSMException
        Query data from each peer specified to see if the condition holds on them. This is roughly equivalent to calling queryRemoteData(TopologyRelationship, IDataQuery), where the query is taken from condition.getQuery(), followed by IDataCondition.isSatisfied(List, List) where the first parameter is the results of the query applied locally and the 2nd is the results of the remote query.

        If the conditions is

        • pair-wise : the condition is evaluated for each peer that responds with data for the query. The returned list includes those sources that provided data that satisfies the condition.
        • aggregate : the condition is evaluated once with all responding peers' data provided to the condition. If the condition is satisfied, the return listed contains all sources of those data.
        Parameters:
        apps -
        condition -
        Returns:
        never null. A list of peers whose results satisfied the condition. An empty list if the condition was not satisfied.
        Throws:
        DSMException

      • queryRemoteData

        java.util.List<? extends QUERYRESULT> queryRemoteData(TopologyRelationship topoRelation,
                                                    QUERY query)
        Query data from peers with the specified toplogical relationship. This is largely a convenience method over queryRemoteData(IPeerSelector, IDataQuery).
        Parameters:
        topoRelation -
        query -
        Returns:
        never null. A list of query results from peers who responded within the timeout.

      • queryRemoteData

        java.util.List<? extends QUERYRESULT> queryRemoteData(TopologyRelationship topoRelation)
        Query for all data from the specified peers. This is a convenience method over queryRemoteData(TopologyRelationship, IDataQuery).
        Parameters:
        topoRelation -
        Returns:
        never null. A list of query results form peers who responded.

      • setUserQueryData

        void setUserQueryData(java.lang.Object userQueryData)
        Provided to allow application-specific data to be passed to IApplicationDataQuery methods applied to local data. Initially this includes the following, but may include others
        • IDataQuery.query(ISharedDataPlatform, Object)
        • IDataQuery.isQueryMatch(ISharedData, ISharedDataPlatform, Object)
        The given object will be passed to all queries (subscribed or one-shot) that this instance makes.
        Parameters:
        userQueryData -

      • addRemoteDataListener

        java.lang.Object addRemoteDataListener(IPeerSelector apps,
                                     CONDITION condition,
                                     ACTION action)
        Install a listener that will receive notifications according to the given specifications of the peers' data, conditions on that data and priority relative to other peers.

        If the condition provided in the handler is null then it is considered to evaluate to true. the handler. If the condition is not null and it is an aggregator (it's isAggregate()) method returns true), then the subscription will wait for the occurence of either a) a fixed amount of time or b) for all the initially identified peers to respond. After either (a) or (b), the condition/action will be called with whatever data is available. After that point, they will be called for each new arrival of data. If the condition is not an aggregator, then the condition/action will be evaluated on every new arrival of data.

        The subscription remains active until it is explicitly canceled with a call to removeRemoteDataListener(Object).

        Must be called after the platform is started using start().

        Parameters:
        apps - specifies a selection of peer applications.
        condition - the condition to be evaluated against the queried data
        action - the action to be taken if the condition evaluates to true.
        userData - optional data provided by the user that will be passed to the handler methods.
        Returns:
        null on failure, otherwise an object that is used to later remove the listener

      • addRemoteDataListener

        java.lang.Object addRemoteDataListener(IPeerSelector apps,
                                     QUERY query,

      • sendMessage

        boolean sendMessage(IApplicationDescriptor dest,
                  IMessage msg)
                    throws DSMException
        Send a message to a specific application peer. The received message is first processed by the platform and if not handled by it, then the peer application will receive it if they have create their own listener via addMessageListener(IMessageListener).
        Parameters:
        dest -
        msg -
        Returns:
        true if the message was put on the wire, but since we operate in a distributed environment, the message may not actually get delivered.
        Throws:
        DSMException

      • addMessageListener

        boolean addMessageListener(IMessageListener listener)
        Register to receive messages sent via sendMessage(IApplicationDescriptor, IMessage). Remote data changes are not received through this listener. To receive remote data changes, use #addRemoteDataListener(IPeerSelector, IDataAction, Object).
        Parameters:
        listener -
        Returns:

      • removeMessageListener

        boolean removeMessageListener(IMessageListener listener)

        Parameters:
        obj -

      • getTopologicalRelationships

        java.util.Collection<TopologyRelationship> getTopologicalRelationships(IApplicationDescriptor peer)
        Get the topological relationships of the given peer to this platform instance. If the given peer is not reachable, then no relationships will be determined. If it is reachable, then the collection will contain TopologyRelationship.Reachable but may contain others (neighbor, parent, etc).
        Parameters:
        peer -
        Returns:
        never null, but perhaps empty if there is not connectivity to the given peer.
